name: PEND_DISCON_ORD_HX
description: This table contains history of information about pending discontinued orders.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the order record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: PEND_DISC_ACTION_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the pending discontinue action for the order. - 1 means the order is still pending discontinued.

columns.name: PEND_DISCON_USER_ID
columns.description: The user who entered pend discontinue for the order.

columns.name: PEND_DISC_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason for discontinue entered by the user who pend discontinued the order. This is usually the same as the internal ID. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Community ID (CID).
entries: Doctor told me to do it.
Change caused by other disease or treatment
Legacy Prescription Brought in as Discontinued

columns.name: PEND_DISC_INST_DTTM
columns.description: Instant at which order was marked as pending discontinued.

columns.name: PEND_DISC_VERBAL_LN
columns.description: This column stores the line index for the Verbal Order Type Flag item in the order record(SI ORD 34800).  It tells which line of data in the Verbal Order Type Flag corresponds to the lines of data in the Pending Discontinue Action item (SI ORD 34892). (SIGNED_TYPE_C column in tables ORDER_SIGNED_MED and PRDER_SIGNED_PROC).

columns.name: PEND_DC_RES_USER_ID
columns.description: User who took action, i.e., verified or rejected the pending discontinued order.

columns.name: PENDDC_RES_INS_DTTM
columns.description: Instant at which an the pending discontinued order was accepted or rejected.
